title: ABL Space Systems rocket stage destroyed in test accident
summary: ABL Space Systems said the second stage of the small launch vehicle they are developing was destroyed in an accident during testing Jan. 19.

title: ABL Space Systems test accident to delay first launch by three months
summary: ABL Space Systems says a test incident that destroyed the upper stage of its RS1 rocket last week will delay that vehicle’s first flight by three months as it identifies and corrects the failure’s root cause.

title: ABL static fires rocket for first orbital launch attempt
summary: ABL Space Systems successfully test-fired the rocket it plans to launch on the company’s first flight in the next several weeks.

title: ABL Space Systems on verge of first orbital launch attempt
summary: ABL Space Systems could launch the first test flight of its one-ton class RS1 rocket from Alaska as soon as this week, after securing a launch license from the Federal Aviation Administration, the company said Sunday.

title: ABL’s first orbital test flight postponed after series of launch attempts
summary: The first test flight of ABL Space Systems’ new small satellite launcher from Alaska has been delayed until no earlier than December after technical issues cut short three launch attempts in the last week.
